snippet: The arrests were the latest in an investigation that has led to charges against 20 other people in what prosecutors said was a major disability fraud scheme at the Long Island Rail Road.
abstract: Ten more retired Long Island Rail Road workers are arrested and charged with federal crimes, accused of falsely claiming to be disabled so they could obtain disability pensions in addition to their railroad pensions; latest arrests bring to 32 the total number of people charged in the scheme, which prosecutors say could have cost the Railroad Retirement Board more than $1 billion in disability disbursements.
lead_paragraph: The arrests were the latest in an investigation that has led to charges against 20 other people in what prosecutors said was a major disability fraud scheme at the Long Island Rail Road.

headline.seo: More L.I.R.R. Retirees Arrested on Fraud Charges
headline.main: More Arrests of Retirees in Fraud Case at L.I.R.R.
headline.print_headline: More Arrests Of Retirees In Fraud Case At L.I.R.R.
